full_text:
1 DETECTIVE: Okay.
2 [REDACTED]
3 But not specifically, oh, three months later he did this, three months later like, I can't do that.
4 
5 
6 DETECTIVE: Okay. When he purchased the car, how far were you, um.
7 [REDACTED]
8 How old was I?
9 DETECTIVE: Yeah.
10 DETECTIVE: That what you mean? He bought the car in, [sigh] I gotta recall, I haven't thought about this in forever. Um. I can I can give you like four, four months that it possibly was during, but I can't specifically remember if it was before or after the New Year. Um, November, December, January February, that just passed.
11 
12 [REDACTED]
13 
14 
15 
16 
17 DETECTIVE: Of 2004?
18 DETECTIVE: Wait a second.
19 [REDACTED]
20 
21 
22 DETECTIVE: So were you a senior in high school when you had the car?
23 DETECTIVE: Yeah, it was recently.
24 
25 
26 DETECTIVE: Okay.
27 It was, it was like, towards the middle and end of my school year. But I remember that for the last like six or eight weeks of high school, I didn't have a car cause I gave it back to him. Because he, he asked me to have sex with him and like, like suck him and stuff [giggles], and I was just like, no. Definitely not. I was like, I'll let you touch me but I'm not gonna do that.
28 [REDACTED]
29 
30 
31 
32 
33 
34 [REDACTED]
35 FRIEND: This is 2005, right?
36 [REDACTED]
37 Yeah, the car was a Dodge Neon 2005. He got it for me before the New Year, because I remember I got it, it was an edition that was a year before they were supposed to come out. So if I got it, I obviously didn't get a 2006 cause that's this year. I got a 2005 Neon in 2004. Seven miles on it when I got it. That car was awesome [giggles].
38 
39 
40 
41 
42 
43 DETECTIVE: Okay. And that's the car that you used to drive to and from,
44 [REDACTED]
45 To and from school, just out with my friends.
46 
Defense Transcript 07/26/17 Page 12 October 11, 2005 RBPD & Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00032664

additional_notes: The document contains redactions, indicated by [REDACTED]. The transcript appears to be from a legal proceeding, likely a deposition or interview, involving a detective and a witness or suspect. The conversation revolves around the purchase of a car and the witness's relationship with the person who purchased it for them.
